body: run integration tests
ok. I saw there is `Schema.LOG` in the issue. Just want to make sure everyone is on the same page.

@sijie @jiazhai I have two questions on this:
1. Is it OK to refine the description as follows?
- Thread mode: when a function runs in thread mode, it runs on the same Java virtual machine (JVM) with Functions worker.
- Process mode: when a function runs in process mode, it runs on the same machine that Functions worker runs.

2. What's the most proper place to add the content in "overview"? Shall we add a new section? It seems that the content is a little too simple for a new section.

Since native functions/SDK, SerDe, Schema Registry, logging, user config, metrics, state storage have been written in [functions-deploy(new) guide](https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/4725), I remove those content from the "overview".
Any issue, feel free to comment. If there is no issue, could we merge this PR?
run integration tests
run java8 tests

@sijie why is this a streamlio question? Looks like the library in question is 
org.apache.pulsar.shade.io.netty.resolver.dns.DnsResolveContext$ 

Is this owned by Streamlio? 

I think the issue has nothing to do with Streamlio. It is that pulsar is unable to resolve a AWS ELB URL and hence cannot connect to pulsar. I am sorry if the mention of streamlio-admin is throwing this thread off.

Hello ! Sorry for the late answer, I was on holyday.

Yes, it was done intentionally because I made two folders : one with the original files (pre kubernetes 1.9) and another one with the updated scripts.

 I copied admin.yaml in both folders for completeness. There  are no changes to the file itself.

@sijie 
I have already added `PulsarKafkaProducerTest`, `PulsarKafkaConsumerTest`, `KafkaProducerConsumerTest`, `KafkaProducerSimpleConsumerTest` which tests kafka producer, high level and low-level consumers. However, I will add api tests as well into separate module.

@sudeepamin 

```
org.apache.pulsar.shade.io.netty.resolver.dns.DnsResolveContext$SearchDomainUnknownHostException: Search domain query failed. Original hostname: 'a5b327ee3ad6d11e989f80a0e47fe403-954928901.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com' failed to resolve 
```
```
Caused by: org.apache.pulsar.shade.io.netty.resolver.dns.DnsNameResolverException: [/fec0:0:0:ffff:0:0:0:1:53] failed to send a query (no stack trace available)
Caused by: org.apache.pulsar.shade.io.netty.channel.unix.Errors$NativeIoException: sendToAddress(..) failed: Network is unreachable
```

The exception you attached in this issue has indicated that Pulsar library has attempted to query the DNS domain and it failed due to network is unreachable. If the network is unreachable, that is beyond what Pulsar library / client can do. It has something related to how do you setup the cluster and the load balancer.

You are using a vendor tool to setup the cluster and the load balancer. The Pulsar community has no knowledge about this vendor tool. So you'd better to reach out the vendor for this question.

@sijie The network is reachable. This was tested by doing a simple nslookup on the AWS ELB URL. If you were trying with the address in the original post that has changed (my apologies. Looking to create a CNAME to abstract code from these changes).  The new address is `ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com`.  It resolves into 3 IP addresses. Moreover, if I pick one of the 3 IP addresses and use it in the same code instead of the ELB URL the code works. So the issue here is that 
org.apache.pulsar.shade.io.netty.resolver.dns.DnsResolveContext$ does not know how to handle a AWS LoadBalancer URL.
/cc @congbobo184 can you please also review this?

@sudeepamin 

I have tried your LB address "ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com". 

*ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com*

- nslookup result: *good*
```
$ nslookup ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com
Server:		192.168.8.1
Address:	192.168.8.1#53

Non-authoritative answer:
Name:	ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com
Address: 23.23.22.177
Name:	ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com
Address: 34.199.105.217
Name:	ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com
Address: 3.210.69.95
```

- curl the web endpoint: *good*

```
$ curl http://ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com:8080/admin/v2/clusters
["quantel"]
```

- use `pulsar-admin` to point to `ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com` : *good*

```
$ bin/pulsar-admin topics list public/default
persistent://public/default/test-1
persistent://public/default/Test-ADT
persistent://public/default/genfixlogs
persistent://public/default/fixmsgs4
persistent://public/default/genfixlog
```

- I used the example you attached in the description. but change to url to `ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com`.

```
import java.util.List;
import org.apache.pulsar.client.api.PulsarClient;

public class TestMain {

    public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception {

        PulsarClient client = PulsarClient.builder()
            .serviceUrl("pulsar://ab30d3c79aee611e9acf102a8b3fc243-31673255.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com:6650")
            .build();

        List<String> partitions =
            client.getPartitionsForTopic("persistent://public/default/test-1")
                .get();

        System.out.println("Get partitions : " + partitions);

        client.close();
    }

}
```

The result is good as well.

```
Get partitions : [persistent://public/default/test-1]
```

----

If I repeated the tests using the LB address you attached in the original code example: `a5b327ee3ad6d11e989f80a0e47fe403-954928901.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com`

```
$ nslookup a5b327ee3ad6d11e989f80a0e47fe403-954928901.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com
Server:		192.168.8.1
Address:	192.168.8.1#53

** server can't find a5b327ee3ad6d11e989f80a0e47fe403-954928901.us-east-1.elb.amazonaws.com: NXDOMAIN
```

---

Based on my tests, I don't see any problems on the Pulsar side.

We use hundred thousands topics per day (topic per user session). I've already explained in detail our case in Pulsar community earlier.

I don't think this is reasonable to set such limit, because you can implement a smart cache or improve the functions API to publish messages without explicit creation a publisher per topic.

> you can implement a smart cache

We can implement a cache for producers.  That closes "old" producers automatically

> improve the functions API to publish messages without explicit creation a publisher per topic.

This cannot be done in Pulsar in general.  With the current producer API, it one producer per topic

I solved the problem by removing "HINT_ANDROID_SEPARATE_MOUSE_AND_TOUCH         = C.SDL_HINT_ANDROID_SEPARATE_MOUSE_AND_TOUCH         // specifies a variable to control whether mouse and touch events are to be treated together or separately" in the file :
C:\Users\lbaha\go\src\github.com\veandco\go-sdl2\sdl\hint.go
Can you explain the link between `HINT_ANDROID_SEPARATE_MOUSE_AND_TOUCH` and the compilation errors: `could not determine kind of name for C.pulsar_...` @laurent75019 ? :thinking:

Hello, @evanhlavaty   according to the information you provided, we have reproduced your process, and the `receiverQueueSize` can be assigned normally.

solr-config.yml as follows:

```
tenant: public
namespace: default
name: solr_kerberos
inputSpecs:
  sample_topic_name:
    receiverQueueSize: 1000000
configs:
  solrUrl: http://sample-solr:8983/solr
  loginConfigurationLocation: "/data/connectors/solr_kerberos_io_jaas.conf"
  collectionName: sample_collection
  documentQueueSize: 5000
  concurrentThreadCount: 25
parallelism: 3
processingGuarantees: ATLEAST_ONCE
retainOrdering: false
autoAck: true
```

### To Reproduce

```
➜  pulsar git:(master) ✗docker run -it -d  -p 8983:8983 --name pulsar-solr-docker solr solr-precreate gettingstarted

➜  pulsar git:(master) ✗ ./bin/pulsar-admin sink create --sink-config-file connectors/solr-config.yaml -a pulsar-io/solr/target/pulsar-io-solr-2.4.0.nar
"Created successfully"
➜  pulsar git:(master) ✗ ./bin/pulsar-admin sink get --tenant public --namespace default --name solr_kerberos
{
 "tenant": "public",
 "namespace": "default",
 "name": "solr_kerberos",
 "className": "org.apache.pulsar.io.solr.SolrGenericRecordSink",
 "inputSpecs": {
   "sample_topic_name": {
     "isRegexPattern": false,
     "receiverQueueSize": 1000000
   }
 },
 "configs": {
   "solrUrl": "http://localhost:8983/solr",
   "documentQueueSize": 5000,
   "concurrentThreadCount": 25,
   "collectionName": "sample_collection"
 },
 "parallelism": 3,
 "processingGuarantees": "ATLEAST_ONCE",
 "retainOrdering": false,
 "autoAck": true
}
```

@sijie 
Updated ManagedCursorImpl to add functionality to persist pending ack messages info to a separate ledger.
Ledger will be created when recover or start to persist pending ack messages info.
If ledger creation failed an internal state will be set to NoLedger.

When asyncUpdatePendingAckPosition API is invoked, it'll check the state, if it's in Open will try to persist  ack messages info to ledger, else it'll persist to ledger meta store and try to create new ledger.

Subscription will also first try to do asyncUpdatePendingAckPosition then update the in memory status it keep about ongoing txns pending ack messages.

Hello @sijie , while this is a perfect technical explanation of why the issue happens; this is not how one would expect a regex pattern based subscription to work.
A regex pattern based subscription should allow the topic-list to grow when new topics are created.
Similarly,
the regex pattern based subscription should allow the topic-list to SHRINK when new topics are DELETED.

Please do let me know if you believe that this is not a valid business requirement.

@AnandSinha agreed. 

the solution I can think of is to add a flag in the consumer to tell the brokers that the consumer is a regex subscription. hence the broker will not auto-create the topic when a regex consumer connects.
@Lanayx  this is a known behavior. see the discussion at #4118. #4118 is already created for tracking an improvement for this.

@sijie  currently we don't have any validation logic for any function worker configs.  We definitely should add that validation logic.  Preferably using the annotation based validation framework I introduced before.  Lets create an issue for this to add validation framework for worker configs, since currently there is nothing of there.  For this PR, lets not add a one off check just for that config.

@jerrypeng Hi Jerry, thank you very much for your comment. When we change the word, we just want to apply a technical writing principle: "Use a prepositional phrase instead of an apostrophe and the letter s (’s) to show the possessive form of abbreviations, brand names, product names, or inanimate objects."
We should have paid attention to "Pulsar Functions" and "a Pulsar Function". Thank you very much for your kind reminder.

In Pattern topics consumer's super class `MultiTopicsConsumerImpl`, there is a method to unsubscribe a given topic in the list:
```
CompletableFuture<Void> unsubscribeAsync(String topicName)
```
You may need first unsub a topic, then delete it.
